query: Assess structural feasibility of Nanostructured Lipid Carrier (NLC) Upadacitinib

context.source: EXP-03 Final Pivot from SLN Failure
evidence: SLN failed due to drug expulsion (SR9=0.27).
NLCs incorporate a liquid lipid (e.g., Oleic Acid) into the solid core.
This creates a chaotic, imperfect crystal lattice with more space for drug accommodation.
Expected to prevent crystallization and significantly improve long-term stability and drug loading.
context.pivot_rationale: Correcting the perfect crystallinity of SLN by adding liquid lipid perturbation.
